content.text:
# Draft:Monica Kim (historian)

Monica Kim is an Korean-American historian and academic. She is William Appleman Williams & David G. and Marion S. Meissner Chair in U.S. International and Diplomatic History, at the University of Wisconsin. She won a MacArthur Fellowship.
Life
She graduated from Yale University, and University of Michigan. She taught at  New York University  She was an Institute for Advanced Study fellow.
Works
* The Interrogation Rooms of the Korean War: The Untold History, Princeton University Press,
* The World that Hunger Made: The Koreas, the United States, and Afro-Asia,
References
